definitions.definition: The act of going backwards ; a reversal .
A piece of misfortune; a setback .
The tails side of a coin, or the side of a medal or badge that is opposite the obverse .
The side of something facing away from a viewer, or from what is considered the front; the other side.
The gear setting of an automobile that makes it travel backwards. (Denoted with symbol R on a shifter's labeling.)
examples: I shifted into reverse and was just about to back up when our silly cat walked behind the car! Honk honk, kitty! Get out of there!

definitions.definition: A thrust in fencing made with a backward turn of the hand; a backhanded stroke.
A turn or fold made in bandaging, by which the direction of the bandage is changed.

secondary_definitions: The act of going backwards ; a reversal . [from 15th c.]
A piece of misfortune; a setback . [from 16th c.]
( numismatics ) The tails side of a coin, or the side of a medal or badge that is opposite the obverse . [from 17th c.]
The side of something facing away from a viewer, or from what is considered the front; the other side. [from 18th c.]
The gear setting of an automobile that makes it travel backwards. (Denoted with symbol R on a shifter's labeling.) [from 19th c.]
A thrust in fencing made with a backward turn of the hand; a backhanded stroke.
( surgery ) A turn or fold made in bandaging, by which the direction of the bandage is changed.
